an3.11:4.1: “Mendicants, a well-known mendicant who has three qualities is acting for the hurt and unhappiness of many people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
an3.11:4.3: They encourage deeds of body and speech, as well as principles, that don’t reinforce good qualities.
an3.11:4.4: A well-known mendicant who has these three qualities is acting for the hurt and unhappiness of many people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
an3.11:5.1: A well-known mendicant who has three qualities is acting for the welfare and happiness of many people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
an3.11:5.3: They encourage deeds of body and speech, as well as principles, that reinforce good qualities.
an3.11:5.4: A well-known mendicant who has these three qualities is acting for the welfare and happiness of many people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”
